reviews.review_msg: Good course.  Interesting lectures. He doesn't use powerpoints or any visual aids so you have to write down what he says.  Textbook is important as you need to read it to get good grades.  Presentation itself is ok but it requires effort.  His lectures however is a bit all over the place so you need to listen and take down the relevant information.

He is extremely knowledgeable and probably the funniest prof I've had. He tends to get off topic sometimes, but at least he knows what he's talking about! His exams are fair, and are based on his lectures/notes. Remember to go to lectures though, because he doesn't tape them.

Awesome TAs really helped us out with marks/hints. Midterm/Final = MC!! No papers or anything. Easy oral presentation and participation. Read the text, go to class, and your good to go. Fairly easy A IMO.
Loved this course, lecture notes were easy to understand. I had a bad TA for the course (Fall 02) made the course difficult, but the topic was good =) would take this prof again!
dynamic lecturer!  very funny, very knowledgable!

Lectures are interesting. He is very laid back. Looks like a skinnier dr. Phil. Had a take home midterm. Final was much harder than expected, too many short answers, not enough time. TA (Sarah P.) was awesome!! Overall... he's ok.

Konarski's a laid-back easy going guy but he's just a little off track most of the time. He tells great anecdotes but doesn't really relate it to subject materials. He wasn't helpful in telling students what the final was on. Lectures useless, but his TA posted all the notes on webct. Just study the notes mostly.
horrible prof! doesn't talk about the final exam.. too much discussion during lectures.. doesn't help with the final exam

This was a pretty decent course. Two papers (~2000 words) plus two exams (40 M/C questions and 90 M/C questions). Exams were somewhat difficult in that they were very detailed. Papers were pretty straightforward. Discussions (10%) were easy marks

Great professor. I came from Kwantlen, and I feel that this professor is a real teacher, not just a stereotypical white old snob of a teacher who believes that the ways he was taught are the best to teach our generation.
